title: General
stimulusHtml:
4 points maximum

Description (2 points)

  • Phospholipid bilayer (credited unless already described in c)

  • Integral protein in membrane

  • Protein’s 3-D shape allows it to act as a channel, bind solutes, and/or bind ATP, as necessary

Explanation (2 points)

  • Some solutes, like ions and larger hydrophobic molecules cannot cross phospholipid membranes unassisted.

  • Integral proteins allow such substances to pass: hydrophilic channel; binding of solute leads to shape change in protein.

  • Hydrolysis of ATP causes shape change in protein leading to shuttle of material from one side of membrane to the other.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.
